text.0: now morning with her earliest light shines forth dear daughter of the sky.
text.1: high aśvins i extol your praise.
text.2: sons of the sea mighty to save discoverers of riches ye.
text.3: gods with deep thought who find out wealth.
text.4: your giant coursers hasten on over the region all in flames.
text.5: when your car flies with winged steeds.
text.6: he liberal lover of the flood lord of the house the vigilant.
text.7: chiefs with oblations feeds you full.
text.8: ye have regard unto our hymns nāsatyas thinking of our words.
text.9: drink boldly of the soma juice.
text.10: vouchsafe to us o aśvin pair such strength as with attendant light.
text.11: may through the darkness carry us.
text.12: come in the ship of these our hymns to bear you to the hither shore.
text.13: o aśvins harness ye the car.
text.14: the heavens wide vessel is your own on the floods shore your chariot waits.
text.15: drops with the hymn have been prepared.
text.16: kaṇvas the drops are in the heaven the wealth is at the waters place.
text.17: where will ye manifest your form.
text.18: light came to lighten up the branch the sun appeared as it were gold.
text.19: and with its tongue shone forth the dark.
text.20: the path of sacrifice was made to travel to the farther goal.
text.21: the road of heaven was manifest.
text.22: the singer of their praise awaits whatever grace the aśvins give.
text.23: who save when soma gladdens them.
text.24: ye dwellers with vivasvān come auspicious as to manu erst.
text.25: come to the soma and our praise.
text.26: o circumambient aśvins dawn follows the brightness of your way.
text.27: approve with beams our solemn rites.
text.28: drink ye of our libations grant protection o ye aśvins twain.
text.29: with aids which none may interrupt.
